title: IRS Chief Pushes Congress for Law Change on Land-Rights Tax Deals
sub_head: Rettig says abusive syndicated conservation easement transactions persist despite stepped-up enforcement
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Internal Revenue Service Commissioner Charles Rettig sought congressional help Tuesday in stopping land-rights deals that the government views as abusive transactions.
Mr. Rettig said so-called syndicated conservation easements have continued despite years of stepped-up IRS enforcement that now includes guaranteed audits, attempts to assert civil fraud penalties, litigation and criminal investigations.
